name: 林彥良
objective: This course aims at providing students with the fundamental knowledge and competence that they will need in doing research and writing research papers.  Its main purpose is to familiarize students with methods, procedures, and techniques that are applicable to quantitative and qualitative research as well as to improve their ability to write research papers.  The main topics for instruction include: the research process; major research methods; and the structure of a research paper.  The research methods primarily studied include the experimental method, descriptive research, ethnography, case study, observation, survey research (questionnaire and interviews), content analysis/documentary analysis, and critical approaches to literature.
schedule:
W1. Introduction to Research:
Different types of research / What is a research paper? 
W2. Research Design:
What makes a good research question? / Online resources
W3. Data Collection & Coding: Audio- and video-recorded data, experiments, questionnaires & interviews, observation, etc. 
W4. Using Computers to Study Texts:
Corpora & discourse analysis; compiling your own corpus
W5. Analyzing Quantitative Data & Statistics
W6. Analyzing Qualitative Data 
W7. APA Style & Citing Sources (Bullock, pp 170-207)
W8. Project Presentation 
W9. Midterm
scorePolicy:
Project Presentation (group presentation): 25%
Project Report (group report): 25%
Midterm: 30%
Participation, In-class Tasks & Assignments: 20%
materials:
Bullock, R., Brody, M., & Weinberg, F. (2017). The little seagull handbook. New York: Norton. (Required, Available in the Taipei Tech bookstore)
Mackey, A., & Gass, S. M. (2015). Second language research: Methodology and design. New York: Routledge. (Available online)
Wray, A., & Bloomer, A. (2006). Projects in linguistics: A practical guide to researching language. London: Hodder Arnold. (Available online)

name: 施欣文
objective:
本課程介紹研究方法和論文寫作知識，期能培養學生獨立研究和撰寫學術報告、論文的基本能力。主要分為三部份：（一）研究內涵與步驟,（二）主要的研究方法,（三）如何撰寫英文論文及報告。涵蓋主題包括：運用圖書館資源選擇研究主題、研究計劃的撰寫、問卷調查法、訪問法、觀察法、田野工作研究方法、文獻資料分析法（內容分析法）、個案研究法、相關研究法、實驗法、文學研究法，研究報告論文格式與寫作要領，如何撰寫文獻探討，參考書目寫法等。
This course aims at providing students with the fundamental knowledge and competence that they will need in doing research and writing research papers. The main topics for instruction include: the research process; major research methods; and the structure of a research paper.  The research methods primarily studied include the experimental method, descriptive research, ethnography, case study, observation, survey research (questionnaire and interviews), content analysis/documentary analysis, and critical approaches to literature.
schedule: Please see the hard copy of the syllabus for the exact weekly topics, which include how to research, how to schedule time, how to write well, how to avoid plagiarism, MLA citation, etc.
scorePolicy:
Grade Percentages:
Presentations: 20%
Quizzes: 20%
Assignments: 25%
Proposal and Annotated Bibliography: 25%
Participation: 10%

As you know, your course grade in this half of the course will be averaged with your course grade in the other half of the course. Please make sure to follow both professors’ rules on attendance, and try to get a high grade in this half of the course in order to balance out any low scores you might get (due to unforeseen circumstances) in the other.
materials:
TEXTS
Bullock, Richard, et al., editors. The Little Seagull Handbook. 3rd ed., Norton, 2017. (680 NT)
Course Packet and/or e-mailed readings and handouts. Please print these. 

SUPPLIES
A reading notebook/journal, pens, and loose-leaf paper for in-class writing and quizzes
A dry-erase marker and a cleaning cloth (Markers should be thick and dark and erase easily.)
